sources.title: $31.5M T-Mobile settlement resolves FCC data breach investigations
sources.snippet: T-Mobile data breach settlement overview: Who: T-Mobile agreed to pay $31.5 million to end multiple Federal Communication Commission investigations into data breach incidents from 2021, 2022 and 2023. Why: The FCC said its investigation revealed the incidents were "varied in their nature, exploitations, and apparent methods of attack."

sources.title: [Update 7: It's Happening] Sprint and T-Mobile have agreed to merger ...
sources.snippet: Understanding Regulatory Scrutiny. The telecommunications sector is heavily regulated, and any significant merger draws the attention of regulatory bodies keen on preserving competition and consumer choice. The merger between Sprint and T-Mobile must navigate a complex landscape of regulatory scrutiny, primarily from the FCC and DOJ.
